column4: the operative word there being 'usually' -- mplayer is the best :-)
mplayer has support for codecs not in vlc (or did over the summer)
specifically it had support for AMR before vlc
how I install mplayer and all codecs?
just get mplayer and vlc and try them both
you can remove one of them later on
it's integrated with gnome -- if you click the places thign and open a place it will launch nautilus
easiest way might be to apt-get build-dep something that depends on them, there are a lot
when I try to ./configure ktorrent, it says: checking for X... configure: error: Can't find X libraries. Please check your installation and add the correct paths!    What can I do?
is ktorrent in universe? if so try apt-get build-dep ktorrent
i cant as its old.  i got the latest version from website
that's ok, this is just for the libraries
the X11 dependencies and so forth are probably the same
